title: What are some examples of content writing? How can I become a freelancer content writer? From where should I start? - Quora

response.answer_text: Everywhere you look online, you can find some examples of content writing. How to make sure, you are reading the good content writing examples? Well, if you can’t stop reading and you want to read a piece of writing more than once, then you have found what you have been looking for. Now, if you want to go deeper into the freelance content writing territory, I would like to suggest you our official blog. Every single post you can find there has been written by freelancers for freelancers. You can also find some useful tips on how to improve your writing, as well. The last part of your question is the most important one. I think that the best thing you can do is to start by signing up on some of the freelance websites. I would like to recommend you goLance for the following reasons: There are NO membership fees to pay for if you want to work on goLance.There is NO limited number of bids. You are free to bid as many times as you want.You don’t have to worry about the fees either because you will always pay a flat 100% fee.You don’t have to wait for three weeks to get paid. Thanks to Payday Advance, you can get paid the very next week after you have submitted your work for a client’s evaluation and review.Your clients can use this marketplace totally free. In addition, they can save a lot thanks to Cashback. The more they spend working with you spend on goLance, the more they will be able to save.goMeter is not just another time tracking tool for hourly projects, but also a unique app that gives you the useful information about the activity percentage for every task in a work diary.Finally, this platform will be the first one to launch a goCredit Program in the near future for both employers and freelancers.I think that my answer represents a good starting point not only for you, but for every freelance content writer who’s looking for online working opportunities. GOod luck!

Do you have a blog? Are you a writer? If you are a capable, professional writer already, but don’t have a blog, then start by creating a blog and learning what content creation is about. If you are not a professional writer (someone who writes daily and is paid for his or her writing.) If you are not a publishing (online or in print media) writer, then learn the ropes and get your career moving. Examples of content writing are all over the internet. I have been a pro writer for 35+ years and blogging daily for 11 years at Ennyman's Territory Creating content pre-existed social media, though. I spearheaded the unfolding of the AMSOIL website, leading its development from when it had 4 pages till it had 7000 pages of content. I similarly initiated their AMSOIL Blog when blogging kicked in circe 2007. Check out what other companies are doing and you will learn what “content creation” is all about. Just as novelists read the Masters (Tolstoy, Hemingway, Fitzgerald) to learn how to write great literature, you will want to read a lot of blog writing to see what content creation is about. And never stop striving to be a better writer. Writing is one of those things that any child can do, yet over a period of two lifetimes you will still not have mastered it. Life (especially the writing life) is for learning. Good luck.
